answers.answer: question where does the pain start for the headache ? and have you had your eyes checked ?

HiWelcome to the MedHelp forum!If you use computer a lot or read a lot then the symptoms of headache with dizziness or blackouts could be due to compression of the spinal nerves in the cervical spine region. This can also happen due to work involving straining of neck, herniated disc, canal stenosis, bone disease, spondylosis, poor posture etc. A MRI of the cervical spine and nerve conduction studies may be required. Please consult a neurologist. Even though you are young, get your blood pressure checked. This can also cause headache with dizziness. TMJ is another possibility. If you have been out in sun a lot or drink less of fluids then it can also be due to electrolyte imbalance or dehydration. Benign intracranial hypertension also causes dizziness with headache and a spinal tap is confirmatory. It can be a migraine attack too. But yes, all these causes should be evaluated. Discuss with your doctor. Take care!
have they tried doing an allergy test? if there is something that you have become allergic to it could possibly cause the headaches and the pain from the headaches can cause you to pass out.

question: For just over a year now i have been getting really bad headaches and have been passing out just about daily.  I have been checked for epilepcy, diabetes, migrains,tention headaches, mental illness.  They have had me on more the 20 different medications and none of them have helped.  I am 22 years old and have always been healthy to this point.
title: terrible headaches for a year
